The Matheron Diptych: Portrait of Rene I The Good (1409-80) Duke of Anjou and his wife

XIR228260 The Matheron Diptych: Portrait of Rene I The Good (1409-80) Duke of Anjou and his wife, Jeanne de Laval (d.1498) c.1475 (oil on panel) (see also 94914-15) by Froment, Nicolas (c.1425-c.83/86); 18x13 cm; Louvre, Paris, France; (add.info.: King of Sicily and Jerusalem; ); French, out of copyright. Media ID 12732354

Chain Of Office Comte De Count Of Provence Duc Danjou Le Bon

Framed Prints

Add a touch of medieval elegance to your home decor with our Framed Prints featuring "The Matheron Diptych: Portrait of Rene I The Good (1409-80) Duke of Anjou and his wife, Jeanne de Laval (d.1498)" by Froment. This exquisite oil on panel painting from Bridgeman Images showcases the regal beauty and power of the Duke and his wife, captured in intricate detail. Each Framed Print is meticulously crafted to preserve the artwork's authenticity and vibrancy, making it a stunning addition to any room. Bring the rich history of the Renaissance period into your space with this timeless piece from Fine Art Finder.

Photo Prints

Experience the elegance and grandeur of the past with Media Storehouse's range of Photographic Prints featuring "The Matheron Diptych: Portrait of Rene I The Good, Duke of Anjou and his wife, Jeanne de Laval." This stunning artwork, created around 1475, showcases the opulence of the Renaissance era with its intricate details and rich colors. Captured in high-resolution, our photographic print brings the beauty of this oil on panel masterpiece by Froment directly to your home or office. Add a touch of history and artistry to your space with this magnificent portrait of Rene I The Good and his wife Jeanne de Laval. Order now from Media Storehouse through Fine Art Finder.

Poster Prints

Bring timeless elegance to your walls with Media Storehouse's exclusive range of poster prints featuring "The Matheron Diptych: Portrait of Rene I The Good, Duke of Anjou and his wife, Jeanne de Laval." This stunning artwork, created around 1475, showcases the exquisite detail and masterful use of oil on panel techniques by the renowned artist Froment. "The Matheron Diptych" is a captivating depiction of the powerful Duke Rene I and his beloved wife, Jeanne de Laval. Add this beautiful and intriguing piece to your home or office decor and let the rich history and artistry of this Fine Art Finder treasure enchant you every day." (Image Source: XIR228260, Bridgeman Images)

Jigsaw Puzzles

Discover the captivating history of the Anjou dynasty with our exquisite jigsaw puzzle from Media Storehouse. Featuring the intricately detailed Matheron Diptych by Froment, this puzzle brings to life the portraits of Rene I The Good, Duke of Anjou, and his wife, Jeanne de Laval. Immerse yourself in the rich tapestry of 15th-century art as you piece together this stunning oil on panel masterpiece, showcasing the elegance and grandeur of the royal couple. A perfect activity for history enthusiasts, art lovers, or anyone seeking a challenging and rewarding puzzle experience.
